{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561732,"name":"Bodi","username":"IthcyPrince","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/dc4da7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T15:10:25.837Z","cooked":"

When trying to add a named command to an auto or a named command event to a path, the text box that appears is unresponsive. I am unable to select the text box, the cursor will not show up, and I cannot type anything in the box. I have no events registered in the pathplanner gui, but they are constructed correctly in our code. I have tried uninstalling pathplanner with no avail. I tried opening last year’s robot project and the text box works perfectly. I am also getting warnings in the driver station log that are shown in the picture. None of the named commands referenced in the warnings are constructed in robotcontainer or in any of the autos in the gui.

image of named commands in robotcontainer

Screenshot 2025-03-19 1108181180×304 32.6 KB

image of warnings in the DS log

Screenshot 2025-03-19 1106521556×263 18.5 KB

You have old pathplanner data in the rio deploy folder.

https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-build-an-auto.html#create-a-sendablechooser-with-all-autos-in-project

Related threads.
Clearing the deploy directory on a roboRIO (running commands on the roboRIO)? - Technical / Java - Chief Delphi

2024 WPILib Feedback - Technical / Programming - Chief Delphi

Thanks, I guess I must’ve missed that part in the docs when setting up our autochooser. oops. Changing deleteOldFiles to true fixed the warnings in the logs, but I am still having the same issue with the pathplanner gui text boxes not working. Any ideas?

It’s normally greyed out, then clicking on it opens it up and shows a message like Search or enter a new name.
How are you installing Pathplanner, which version are you using and what type of computer?

The solution ended up being copying and pasting the deploy folder from one of our very first versions of our code from this year. Unfortunately this means remaking a lot of our paths and autos, but at least it is working now. I am still curious as to what was causing it.
